description.plain:
Grandson, born Jordan Benjamin, is a 28-year-old alternative artist hailing from Toronto, Canada. Born in the small town of Englewood, New Jersey, he relocated to the cultural melting pot of Toronto at a young age and grew up surrounded by music ranging from jazz to rock and roll to rap, dancehall, and R&B. He began playing guitar and piano in high school.

At 17, he relocated to Montreal, QC to attend university and began working in nightclubs cleaning tables and DJing. He started writing music at this time, incorporating the unique blend of sounds he grew up surrounded by. He started experimenting with music production and rapping in 2013, and dropped out of school to relocate to Los Angeles and pursue music full time.

Adopting the Grandson moniker while living in LA, he dove deeply into rock influences such as Rage Against the Machine, Nirvana, and Led Zeppelin, while also listening to rap/R&B music emerging out of Toronto and alternative acts such as Twenty One Pilots and Hiatus Kaiyote. He found a small community of musicians to work and perform with in Los Angeles. Live shows try to create a frantic mosh pit inducing a cathartic release of energy for concert goers, influenced by early punk and grunge music.

Searching for his voice and for meaning in today’s divisive, chaotic world, Grandson confronts the most pressing issues of his generation through his songwriting, such as financial inequality, governmental and environmental accountability, and social justice, giving these topics a soundtrack with a genuine sense of urgency and frustration. His music also touches on adolescence, relationships, and the insecurities and difficulties of growing up through your 20s. When asked about today’s music scene, he says “I genuinely believe the world needs honest rock and roll, now more than ever”.

-adapted from artist’s site

Born in the small town of Englewood, New Jersey, he relocated to the cultural melting pot of Toronto at a young age and grew up surrounded by music ranging from jazz to rock and roll to rap, dancehall, and R&B. He started writing music at this time, incorporating the unique blend of sounds he grew up surrounded by. Adopting the Grandson moniker while living in LA, he dove deeply into rock influences such as Rage Against the Machine, Nirvana, and Led Zeppelin, while also listening to rap/R&B music emerging out of Toronto and alternative acts such as Twenty One Pilots and Hiatus Kaiyote. He found a small community of musicians to work and perform with in Los Angeles. Live shows try to create a frantic mosh pit inducing a cathartic release of energy for concert goers, influenced by early punk and grunge music.

Searching for his voice and for meaning in today’s divisive, chaotic world, Grandson confronts the most pressing issues of his generation through his songwriting, such as financial inequality, governmental and environmental accountability, and social justice, giving these topics a soundtrack with a genuine sense of urgency and frustration. His music also touches on adolescence, relationships, and the insecurities and difficulties of growing up through your 20s. When asked about today’s music scene, he says “I genuinely believe the world needs honest rock and roll, now more than ever”.

songs.title: Blood // Water

description.plain:
This song is about corporate greed and political corruption, culminating in environmental degradation. Together with “War,” “Blood // Water” boosted grandson’s popularity to what it has become today.

This song and grandson himself were further exposed to a wider audience when it was featured in Episode 21 of Season 2 (“Judgment Night”) of the insanely-popular teen drama show Riverdale. It was also the theme for NXT Takeover: Brooklyn 4, which further increased its popularity.

The single quickly became the most popular component of his “a modern tragedy vol. 1” project, and his biggest record thus far.

Due to its success, 5 official remixes have been released as well as an acoustic version and a live version (part of his Garage Gigs Live) project. The song has garnered more than 500 million streams on Spotify and peaked at #19 on Billboard Top Rock Songs Chart on September 22nd, 2018.

songs.embed_content: Read “Blood // Water” by ​grandson on Genius

songs.title: ​​thoughts & prayers

description.plain:
Released in the wake of the Parkland shooting, one of the deadliest mass shootings in recent history, “thoughts & prayers” offers musings on mass shootings and the general state of gun politics in America. Many of the events mentioned within the song have happened following mass shootings, with grandson bringing a laser focus on politicians who put on a good face for press conferences without actually making concrete changes.

The song was debuted at a pre-March for Our Lives event, with the choral portions being sung in person by the West Los Angeles Children’s Choir. Limited-edition merchandise was sold at nothoughtsnoprayers.org, with the song sold largely on Bandcamp. All proceeds benefit the Youth For Safety and Justice Fund.

songs.title: Overdose

description.plain:
Continuing his reputation for bluntly discussing social topics, grandson’s “Overdose” is about the effect drugs have on an individual, how they’re used to escape pain, and how habitual use creates a dependency that users keep chasing, with the lows between getting worse. This ultimately leads addicts to overdose, as they keep trying to chase the same high they got initially.

The lyrics, told from the viewpoint of an addicted individual, provide a sense of personalization to the cycle of addiction. Rather than dismissing addiction as a moral fault, grandson instead points to societal factors that cause addicts to seek drugs in the first place.

Centered around the opioid crisis in the United States, the song serves as a prophetic warning to listeners, and a plead to current drug abusers to seek help. A screen at the end of the official music video directly addresses viewers, urging them to call the NIDA drug abuse hotline at 1-800-662-HELP if they or someone they know struggles from drug addiction.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSWf8KggnII
